titleInfo.title: LIEUTENANT COLONEL JAMES ``MAGGIE'' MEGELLAS POST OFFICE

extension.searchTitle: LIEUTENANT COLONEL JAMES ``MAGGIE'' MEGELLAS POST OFFICE; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 35

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the bill was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory2: Designating the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 99 West 2nd Street in Fond du Lac, Wisconsin, as the Lieutenant Colonel James ``Maggie'' Megellas Post Office
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measure which was debated on Tuesday, March 1st:<P/>S. 1826, to designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 99 West 2nd Street in Fond du Lac, Wisconsin, as the Lieutenant Colonel James ``Maggie'' Megellas Post Office, by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 406 yeas to 1 nay, Roll No. 108.

titleInfo.title: BLOCKING REGULATORY INTERFERENCE FROM CLOSING KILNS ACT OF 2016

extension.searchTitle: BLOCKING REGULATORY INTERFERENCE FROM CLOSING KILNS ACT OF 2016; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 35

congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Blocking Regulatory Interference from Closing Kilns Act of 2016
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.R. 4557, to allow for judicial review of any final rule addressing national emission standards for hazardous air pollutants for brick and structural clay products or for clay ceramics manufacturing before requiring compliance with such rule, by a yea-and-nay vote of 238 yeas to 163 nays, Roll No. 109.

extension.searchTitle: THE JOURNAL; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 35

congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to the Speaker's approval of the Journal by recorded vote of 217 ayes to 154 noes with one answering ``present'', Roll No. 110.

congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Blocking Regulatory Interference from Closing Kilns Act of 2016
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.R. 4557, to allow for judicial review of any final rule addressing national emission standards for hazardous air pollutants for brick and structural clay products or for clay ceramics manufacturing before requiring compliance with such rule, by a yea-and-nay vote of 238 yeas to 163 nays, Roll No. 109.

congVote.result: ``Yes'' on rollcall vote No. 102 (on the motion to suspend the rules and pass H.R. 4238).
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to the Speaker's approval of the Journal by recorded vote of 217 ayes to 154 noes with one answering ``present'', Roll No. 110.
